case_address_found_1: one mile west of I-19 frontage road at exit 48
case_circumstances:
Nearly complete mummified remains found by US Border Patrol in desert area on 28 November 2007.
Mandible found by hunter in remote desert area and received by the PCSO 31 January 2008. 
Cranium and first two cervical vertebrae discovered in desert by US Border Patrol on 8 June 2008.
DNA analyses linked these three accessions, thus information from NamUs UP #6082 and UP #4917 have now been merged into this NamUs file.
fingerprints: Fingerprint information is available and entered
case_clothing_on_body: One gray and red plaid shirt (Brand:  Rock Creek Ranch, Size: XL).  One blue and white horizontal striped shirt (Brand:  Extend, Size: L).  One pair of blue jeans (Brand:  Lee).   One white Texas Longhorns hat. Two coats: one a blue corduroy (Brand:  St. Johns Bay, Size:XXL), and one blue fleece ( Brand: Old Navy, Size: L).
case_clothing_with_body: Several backpacks were found: one blue, one black, one white and pink, and two gray.
case_footwear: One pair of blue and white shoes (Brand: Saetta).
dental: Dental information / charting is available and entered
documents: There are currently no documents available for this case.
